    question => UTF-8 string (418) "<p>3. Names of the person(s) from the entity involved in the discussion:</p>...
    $value[2]['question']
    <p>3.	Names of the person(s) from the entity involved in the discussion:</p>
<i>This must include a representative from ‘those charged with governance’ (e.g. a director of the company) and management. Whilst for many entities ‘those charged with governance’ will also be ‘management’, where Ac2 identifies that this is not the case, it must be ensured that going concern is discussed with both groups.</i>

    question => UTF-8 string (627) "<p>If the entity has not prepared formal forecasts or similar for a period o...
    $value[4]['question']
    <p>If the entity has not prepared formal forecasts or similar for a period of at least twelve months from the end of the reporting period, document the nature of the client’s assessment of going concern. </p>
<i>This assessment could include:</i>
<ul>
    <li><i>Formal budgets on a rolling quarterly basis looking forward, supported by a more informal assessment of the subsequent period</i></li>
    <li><i>Informal assessment by way of expectations of the level of repeat custom and expenses, timing of significant orders, working capital requirements, significant future ‘one-off’ expenditure etc.</i></li>
</ul>

    question => UTF-8 string (475) "<p>Where a formal assessment of going concern has been prepared by the entit...
    $value[0]['question']
    <p>Where a formal assessment of going concern has been prepared by the entity obtain a copy, along with backing schedules and supportive information. Consider whether entity’s expectations are realistic and can be supported by evidence obtained elsewhere on file. In particular, compare any budgets and projections to post year end management accounts, review the reasonableness of the assumptions and consider how reliable management information has historically been.</p>

    <p>Where the client has not made a formal assessment of going concern, or this assessment does not cover the period up to twelve months from the end of the reporting period, consider whether the informal assessment of going concern is supported by evidence elsewhere on file.     question => UTF-8 string (881) "<p>Review the following documents on the audit file and ensure that they sup...
    $value[3]['question']
    <p>Review the following documents on the audit file and ensure that they support (or don’t conflict with) the client’s assessment of the entity’s going concern status:-</p>
<ul>
    <li>Planning documentation, including: points forward, preliminary discussions with the client; preliminary analytical procedures, the assignment plan and briefing notes [Ac Section];</li>
    <li>The subsequent events review [Aa3a];</li>
    <li>Review of ISA compliance critical issues memorandum / significant risks [Aa7];</li>
    <li>Final analytical procedures, including particularly key performance indictors regarding, profitability; liquidity, and gearing [Aa10];</li>
    <li>Review of bank covenants [I Section];</li>
    <li>Review of contingent liabilities [L Section]; and</li>
    <li>The results of the review of board and shareholder meetings [M Section].</li>
</ul>

    <p>Consider any other specific issues that could impact on the going concern status of the client, these might include:-</p>
<ul>
    <li>Impending litigation, or regulatory action against the client;</li>
    <li>Changes in legislation or government (both national and local) policy;</li>
    <li>Changes to local planning law which could adversely affect the client; and</li>
    <li>Technological or market developments which would render the client’s products or services obsolete or uncompetitive.</li>
</ul>

    question => UTF-8 string (942) "<p>The financial statements must:</p> <ol type="a"> <li>) adequately disclos...
    $value[2]['question']
    <p>The financial statements must:</p>
<ol type="a">
    <li>) adequately disclose the principal events or conditions that may cast significant doubt on the entity’s ability to continue as a going concern and management’s plans to deal with these events or conditions; and </li>
    <li>) Disclose clearly that there is a material uncertainty related to events or conditions that may cast significant doubt on the entity’s ability to continue as a going concern and, therefore, that it may be unable to realize its assets and discharge its liabilities in the normal course of business.</li>
</ol><p>If adequate disclosure has been made, the opinion shall be unmodified but the audit report shall include a separate section under the heading “Material uncertainty related to Going Concern”.</p><p>If adequate disclosure is not made, the auditor shall express a qualified opinion or adverse opinion, in accordance with ISA 705.</p>
